tit.e: "Sonpi Bunmyaku," the biographies of the nobles and humbles
"Sonpi Bunmyaku," the biographies of the nobles and humbles
"Sonpi Bunmyaku," the biographies of the nobles and humbles

sen.j: 尊卑分脈（正しくは『尊卑分脉』、そんぴぶんみゃく）は、日本の初期の系図集である。
sen.e: "Sonpi Bunmyaku," the biographies of the nobles and humbles is an early Japanese collection of genealogical tables.
"Sonpi Bunmyaku," the biographies of the nobles and humbles is an early Japanese collection of genealogical tables.
Sonpi Bunmyaku is a text compiled in early Japan that records the lineages of the aristocracy.
sen.cmt: 全体的に書き換えました。

sen.j: 正式名称は『新編纂圖本朝尊卑分脈系譜雜類要集』である。
sen.e: The full title is "Shin-Hensanzu-Honcho-Sonpi-Bunmyaku-Keifu-Zatsurui-Yoshu."
The full title is "Shin-Hensanzu-Honcho-Sonpi-Bunmyaku-Keifu-Zatsurui-Yoshu."
The full title is "Shin-Hensanzu-Honcho-Sonpi-Bunmyaku-Keifu-Zatsurui-Yoshu."

sen.j: 通常、名称が長いために、略されて、『尊卑分脉』と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Generally, the name is so long that it is called "Sonpi Bunmyaku" for short.
Generally, however, this long name is shortened to "Sonpi Bunmyaku".
Generally, however, this long name is shortened to "Sonpi Bunmyaku".

sen.j: 別名に『新編纂圖本朝尊卑分脈系譜雜類要集』がある。
sen.e: It is also known as "Shoke-Okeizu."
It is also known as "Shoke-Okeizu."
It is also known as "Shoke-Okeizu."

sen.j: 姓氏調査の基本図書のひとつで、南北朝時代 (日本)から室町時代初期に完成した。
sen.e: It was one of the basic books for research and investigation of family names, and was finished from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the Muromachi period.

It is one of the basic books for research and investigation of family names, and was completed over a period spanning from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the beginnning of the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: The first translation is ambiguous. Was the book translated at some point during the described period or over the described period. I have reworked the sentence assuming the latter, but this should be checked.
sen.e: It is one of the basic books for research and investigation of family names, and was completed over a period spanning from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the beginning of the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 編者は、洞院公定（とういん きんさだ、1340年 - 1399年）で、主に永和 (日本)3年（1377年）から応永2年（1395年）にかけて編纂された。
sen.e: The book was edited by Kinsada TOIN (1340-1399), and mainly compiled from 1377 to 1395.
The book was edited by Kinsada TOIN (1340-1399), and mainly compiled from 1377 to 1395.
The book was edited by Kinsada TOIN (1340-1399), and mainly compiled from 1377 to 1395.

sen.j: ただし、公定没後も養子洞院満季、孫の洞院実煕ら洞院家の人によって編集・改変・訂正・追加が行われた。
sen.e: However, after Kinsada's death, the members of the house of TOIN, such as his adopted son, Mitsusue TOIN and his grandson, Sanehiro TOIN, carried out editing, alteration, correction, and addition.
After Kinsada's death, various members of the house of TOIN, including his adopted son, Mitsusue TOIN and his grandson, Sanehiro TOIN, continued to edit, alter, correct, and make additions.
sen.cmt: Changed sentence to get rid of "carried out".
sen.e: After Kinsada's death, various members of the house of TOIN, including his adopted son, Mitsusue TOIN and his grandson, Sanehiro TOIN, continued to edit, alter, correct, and make additions.

sen.j: 室町時代以降、広く増補改訂されたため、異本が多く、30巻本・20巻本・14巻本が流布した。
sen.e: After the Muromachi period, the enlargement and revision were made so drastically that there were many variant books, and the one in 30 volumes, 20 volumes, and 14 volumes were circulated.

After the Muromachi period, the book was drastically enlarged and revised and a number of differing editions were circulated, including an edition in 30 volumes, an edition in 20 volumes, and an edition in 14 volumes.
sen.cmt: Introduced "editions" to make sentence read more naturally.
sen.e: After the Muromachi period, the book was drastically enlarged and revised and a number of differing editions were circulated, including an edition in 30 volumes, an edition in 20 volumes, and an edition in 14 volumes.

sen.j: 成立当初は帝皇系図・神祇道系図・宿曜道系図を伴ったらしいが失われ、現存する部分は源平藤橘のうち藤原氏・源氏の両氏（いずれも長く宮廷社会の中枢にいた）に詳しい。
sen.e: When it was written, a genealogical table of the Imperial, a genealogical table of gods, and a genealogical table of astrology might be included in the book at first, but they were lost, and those that survived were especially detailed about the Fujiwara and the Minamoto clans (because both clans had taken over the key positions in the court society) among Gen, Pei, Tou, Kitsu that were distinguished families of the Minamoto, the Taira, the Fujiwara, and the Tachibana.

When first written, a genealogical table of the Imperial line, a genealogical table of the gods, and a genealogical table of astrology appear to have been included, but these have been lost, with the surviving books being especially detailed on the Fujiwara and the Minamoto clans (because both had taken over key positions in the court society) among the distinguished families which included the Minamoto, the Taira, the Fujiwara, and the Tachiban (also known as the Gen, Pei, Tou, Kitsu due to Chinese readings of the characters in their names).
sen.cmt: Corrected "might be" to "appear to have been". Also reworked the second part of the sentence, adding a section in brackets to explain what Gen, Pei, Tou, and Kitsu are".
sen.e: When first written, a genealogical table of the Imperial line, a genealogical table of the gods, and a genealogical table of astrology appear to have been included, but these have been lost, with the surviving books being especially detailed on the Fujiwara and the Minamoto clans (because both had taken over key positions in the court society) among the distinguished families which included the Minamoto, the Taira, the Fujiwara, and the Tachibana (also known as the Gen, Pei, To, Kitsu due to Chinese readings of the characters in their names).

sen.j: 直線で父系を結び、女性は后妃など極めて一握りの人を除き「女子」と省略される（紫式部など有名な女性も例外ではない）。
sen.e: The paternal line is connected with a straight line, and women except a handful of people like empresses are described merely as "women." (Famous women such as Shikibu MURASAKI are not excepted.)

In the book, the paternal line is represented as a straight line, and women, except for empresses and a handful of others, are nameless, being described merely as "women" (even famous women such as Shikibu MURASAKI remain nameless).
sen.cmt: Reworked sentence to make it read better.
sen.e: In the book, the paternal line is represented as a straight line, and women, except for empresses and a handful of others, are nameless, being described merely as "women" (even famous women such as Shikibu MURASAKI remain nameless).

sen.j: 系図に名の見える男性官人には、実名とともに生母・官歴・没年月日と享年の注記を含む略伝が付され、最も貴重である。
sen.e: The male government officials mentioned in the genealogical tables are described with their real names and abbreviate biographies including a real mother, the record of official position, the date of death, the age at death, and footnotes; thus, in this regard, this book is extremely valuable.

For male government officials, the genealogical tables contain real names and abbreviated biographies, including mother's name, official position, date of death, age at death and footnotes, making the book an extremely valuable source of information.
sen.cmt: Edited sentence to make it read more smoothly, and get rid of semi-colon.
sen.e: For male government officials, the genealogical tables contain real names and abbreviated biographies, including mother's name, official position, date of death, age at death and footnotes, making the book an extremely valuable source of information.

sen.j: 平安時代および鎌倉時代に関する記載は一級の史料として採用される。
sen.e: The description of the Heian and the Kamakura periods is accepted as a historical source of the highest value.
The records of the Heian and the Kamakura periods are recognized as a historical source of the highest value.
sen.cmt: The document is a "record" rather than a "description".
sen.e: The records of the Heian and the Kamakura periods are recognized as a historical source of the highest value.

sen.j: 公定死後の部分に関しては他の史料との整合性や比較批評が必要とされる。
sen.e: The part written after Kinsada's death needs the consistnency with other historical materials and the comparative critical approach.
The section written after Kinsada's death requires a more critical approach and and has to be checked against other sources.
The section written after Kinsada's death requires a more critical approach and has to be checked against other sources.

sen.j: また、加筆されている部分も同様である。
sen.e: The same goes for the added part of this book.
The same goes for other added sections.
The same goes for other added sections.
